intro: Chamaeraphis parvigluma, commonly known as the small-leaved sea rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, alternate leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Chamaeraphis parvigluma is often found in maritime environments, where it tolerates salt spray and strong winds.
